column4: why is ubuntu release cycle so fast? its in constant beta cycle :/
We have a fast cycle in order to keep up with constant development in the OSS world.
We dont' have any managers or marketers or strategests telling us what to develop and when, so everybody develops at their own speed and Ubuntu just packages it all up and delivers it to users.
tbh, i dont get it why xorg and gnome folks are doing that too
However, we have LTS releases for people who want a lower cycle, and there are other distros which focus primarily on stability and will give you a more dedicated slow-cycle experience.
yeah i had 6.06 lts, but the problem is you cant get new softare for it
What do you want? A stable system with old software, or an unstable system with new software? The instability is because of new software.
why cant the system be stable with new software? this is how windows works.'
its not like every update to XP installed new version of shell for instance
That's not how Windows works. Windows just lets third-party software update itself, so your system is as unstable as whatever apps you install want it to be.
no, its been stable and unchanged for since the first release.
your system is stable but applications are what they are
What is your "system", if not the applications?
the os and the shell (so for example linux kernel+base+gnome)
but the gnome folks seem eager to be in a beta cycle all the time as well :)
